intro: Cyrtopera acutilabra, commonly known as the sharp-leafed Cyrtopera, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often in shades of pink or purple. Cyrtopera acutilabra is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
